text: Mount Isa is a city in the north west region of Queensland, Australia. In June 2006 there 18,857 people living in the city. and 31,000ABS Census 2006 QLD North West Statistical Division in the region. Mount Isa began in the 1920s as a mining town. Mount Isa Mines (MIM) is one of the most productive mines in the world, producing lead, silver, copper, and zinc. ==References== Category:Cities in Queensland
title: Mount Isa
